Ad Text:
LTI Mindtree is seeking an experienced Azure Analytics Data Architect to lead the design and delivery of enterprise-grade Azure data platforms for public sector and large enterprise clients. This role requires strong expertise across Azure analytics services, data engineering best practices, and cloud architectural governance. The ideal candidate will bring deep technical capability, architectural leadership, and the ability to design secure, scalable, and future-ready data ecosystems. Active NV1/NV2 security clearance is mandatory.

Key Responsibilities

Architect and implement end-to-end Azure data solutions spanning ingestion, storage, processing, analytics, and governance.
Define and maintain enterprise-wide Azure data architecture standards that align with security, compliance, and operational frameworks.
Utilize key Azure services such as Microsoft Fabric, Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Data Lake Storage, Data Factory, Cosmos DB, and Azure SQL to deliver high-performing solutions.
Build, optimize, and automate scalable ETL/ELT pipelines using ADF, Synapse, metadata-driven frameworks, and CI/CD practices.
Provide architectural leadership across data modeling, integration workflows, analytics pipelines, and cross-system interoperability.
Implement strong data governance, data quality, identity controls, and privacy protection across Azure environments.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and application teams to deliver structured, governed, and accessible datasets.
Create and maintain architecture documentation, solution blueprints, and implementation roadmaps.
Ensure architecture alignment with Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF), Well-Architected Framework (WAF), and organizational technology standards.
Drive continuous improvement across performance, reliability, cost optimization, operational excellence, and security posture.
Qualifications

Active NV1/NV2 Security Clearance (mandatory, role cannot be performed without it)
10+ years of experience in Data Architecture, Data Engineering, Cloud Analytics, or enterprise data platform delivery
Deep hands-on expertise with Azure analytics services including Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, Data Lake, Fabric, Cosmos DB, and Azure SQL
Strong knowledge of data modeling, warehousing concepts, ETL/ELT best practices, and distributed data processing
Experience working with both relational and NoSQL data systems, including PostgreSQL and Cosmos DB
Proven capability in designing scalable, secure, and governed cloud architectures at enterprise scale
Experience with CI/CD, infrastructure-as-code, metadata-driven frameworks, and modern DevOps practices
Exceptional communication, documentation, and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to convey complex architecture concepts to both technical and business audiences

At LTI Mindtree Australia, you’ll have the opportunity to work on nation-critical transformation programs while being part of a global organization known for innovation, excellence, and a strong Azure data practice. You will join a collaborative team that values technical leadership, continuous learning, and impactful delivery. This is your chance to shape the data landscape for some of the region’s most strategic clients, all while growing your career in a supportive and future-focused environment.

Category: Policy, Planning & Regulation, Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Your new opportunity:
As a Principal Treasury Analyst, you will lead the monitoring and analysis of financial and non-financial performance across Queensland Government agencies, providing strategic advice to support the development and implementation of sound public policy.

This is an exciting opportunity to work with internal and external clients and stakeholders to address complex financial and policy matters, identify risks, and develop strategic solutions that align with the Government's economic priorities. You will play a critical role in delivering high-quality advice, reports and recommendations to senior executives, ministerial offices and interdepartmental committees, ensuring that Queensland Treasury continues to drive the state's economic growth and sustainability.

In this role, you will:
• Provide strategic advice and support to clients and senior executives on complex budget, financial management, and policy issues.
• Lead the development and implementation of processes to monitor and analyse agencies' budget and financial information.
• Offer expert advice on risk identification, management, and evaluation of best practice financial strategies and policies.
• Manage relationships with clients and stakeholders to resolve complex issues and negotiate positive outcomes.
• Represent Treasury on internal and external committees and interdepartmental working groups.
• Prepare complex reports, submissions, briefing notes, and correspondence within tight timeframes.
• Support organisational strategy, direction, and initiatives.

What experience you will bring:
To excel in this role, you will demonstrate:
• The ability to lead teams and deliver outcomes in a complex and time-sensitive environment.
• Experience in analysing financial and non-financial performance data and/or developing government policy.
• Expertise in providing strategic, practical, and solutions-focused analysis and advice.
• Influential communication skills tailored to diverse audiences.
• Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills to foster collaboration and information sharing.
• Effective judgement and understanding of different perspectives to develop solutions and work collaboratively.

Whilst there are no mandatory qualifications needed for this role, relevant qualifications will be highly regarded.

How to apply:
To submit your application, click on the Apply link to provide:
• Your resume detailing relevant experience.
• A cover letter of no more than two pages outlining why you are interested in this position and how your knowledge, skills and experience makes you a strong candidate for the role.

Queensland Treasury is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve and treating all applicants equitably. This starts with recruitment, including making reasonable adjustments to support applicants at all stages of the process.

We welcome applicants to share with the hiring manager any health condition, disability and/or cultural or linguistic background, so that we may make any necessary adjustments to enable you to equitably participate in the recruitment process.

Applications to remain current for 12 months.

Job Ad Reference: QLD/670711/25

Closing Date: Tuesday, 02 December 2025
